import React, { useState } from "react"; import { NavLink, Link } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaUser, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa"; import "./index.css"; // Dummy blog post data (replace with actual data or fetch from backend) const blogPosts = [ { id: 1, title: "Dolorum optio tempore voluptas dignissimos", category: "Technology", author: "Maria Doe", date: "Jan 1, 2022", image: "assets/img/blog/blog-1.jpg", authorImage: "assets/img/blog/blog-author.jpg", excerpt: "Explore the latest trends in technology and innovation...", }, { id: 2, title: "Innovative Solutions in Web Development", category: "Programming", author: "John Smith", date: "Feb 15, 2023", image: "assets/img/blog/blog-2.jpg", authorImage: "assets/img/blog/blog-author-2.jpg", excerpt: "Discover cutting-edge approaches to modern web development...", }, { id: 3, title: "AI and Machine Learning Breakthroughs", category: "Artificial Intelligence", author: "Sarah Johnson", date: "Mar 20, 2023", image: "assets/img/blog/blog-3.jpg", authorImage: "assets/img/blog/blog-author-3.jpg", excerpt: "Insights into the latest advancements in AI technology...", }, ]; const BlogPage = () => { const [currentPage, setCurrentPage] = useState(1); const postsPerPage = 6; // Pagination logic const indexOfLastPost = currentPage * postsPerPage; const indexOfFirstPost = indexOfLastPost - postsPerPage; const currentPosts = blogPosts.slice(indexOfFirstPost, indexOfLastPost); const pageNumbers = []; for (let i = 1; i <= Math.ceil(blogPosts.length / postsPerPage); i++) { pageNumbers.push(i); } const paginate = (pageNumber) => setCurrentPage(pageNumber); return (

Blog

Discover insights, trends, and stories from our expert writers across various domains of technology and innovation.

  1. Home
  2. Blog
{currentPosts.map((post) => (

{post.category}

{post.title}

{post.excerpt}

{post.author}

{post.date}
))} {/* Repeat the above block for other blog posts */}
    {pageNumbers.map((number) => (
  • paginate(number)}> {number}
    • ))}
); }; export default BlogPage;
